channel.title: Terminal on victoria.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Terminal on victoria.dev

item.title: Git commit practices your future self will thank you for
item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: A history of clean commits can be evidence of a lot of things: attention to detail, good work ethic, and genuine investment in the project. What do your Git commits say about you? If, like me, there might be one or two less than stellar ones, well, we’re only human. A nice part of being human is having the ability to learn new and complex things fairly quickly, and continuously improve ourselves.

item.title: An automatic interactive pre-commit checklist, in the style of infomercials
item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: What’s that, you say? You’ve become tired of regular old boring paper checklists? Well, my friend, today is your lucky day! You, yes, you, can become the proud owner of a brand-spanking-new automatic interactive pre-commit hook checklist! You’re gonna love this! Your life will be so much easier! Just wait until your friends see you. What’s a pre-commit hook? Did you know that nearly 1 out of 5 coders are too embarrassed to ask this question?

item.title: Batch renaming images, including image resolution, with awk
item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: The most recent item on my list of “Geeky things I did that made me feel pretty awesome” is an hour’s adventure that culminated in this code: $ file IMG* | awk 'BEGIN{a=0} {print substr($1, 1, length($1)-5),a++"_"substr($8,1, length($8)-1)}' | while read fn fr; do echo $(rename -v "s/$fn/img_$fr/g" *); done IMG_20170808_172653_425.jpg renamed as img_0_4032x3024.jpg IMG_20170808_173020_267.jpg renamed as img_1_3024x3506.jpg IMG_20170808_173130_616.jpg renamed as img_2_3024x3779.jpg IMG_20170808_173221_425.jpg renamed as img_3_3024x3780.jpg IMG_20170808_173417_059.jpg renamed as img_4_2956x2980.

item.title: How to replace a string in a dozen old blog posts with one sed terminal command
item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: June 1, 2018: This post was previously titled “That time 30 seconds, StackOverflow, and sed saved me 30 minutes” and has since been revised and updated with more examples and a couple new doodles. It’s better now. I’ve had more than a few usernames, URLs, and Twitter handles over the years. Whether it was changing to something that better reflected my current interests or briefly getting caught up in the “.
